175.title: Anupam Kher shares pics of his physical transformation on his 67th birthday
175.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher took to Twitter to share pictures of his physical transformation on the occasion of his 67th birthday. "I have always believed in reinventing myself. Today as I start my 67th year, I am motivated to share these pics with you. I know I have miles to go," he wrote, adding that he wants to inspire people.

176.title: India's daily COVID-19 cases drop below 5,000-mark, 66 deaths reported in 24 hours
176.article_body: India has reported 4,362 new COVID-19 cases and 66 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 66 deaths, 51 deaths occurred during the day in the country while 15 were reconciled deaths in Kerala. The daily positivity rate stood at 0.71% and the active cases stood at 54,118.

177.title: Sensex plunges over 1,600 points, drops below 53,000 for 1st time in 7 months
177.article_body: Sensex plunged over 1,600 points to trade at over 52,600, while Nifty was down over 400 points at over 15,820 in the opening session on Monday as Russia-Ukraine war entered its 12th day. This is the first time in over seven months that Sensex dropped below 53,000. Tata Steel is the only gainer on Sensex today so far.

178.title: I think a lot of players are comfortable with Rohit's captaincy: Jaffer
178.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said Rohit Sharma is looking comfortable captaining India across formats. He added, "Lot of players are [also] looking comfortable with his captaincy. Rohit gives them a lot of freedom. He got his field placing and bowling changes spot on." Jaffer further said, "You can see the smiling faces in Indian camp and that's nice to see."

179.title: Suspension of special operation only possible if Ukraine stops military operations: Putin
179.article_body: In a phone call with Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan, Russian President Vladimir Putin said that the suspension of its "special operation" is only possible if Ukraine stops its military operations and carries out well-known Russian demands, according to the Kremlin. Putin added that his "special operation" in Ukraine was going according to plan and to schedule.

180.title: A casting director told me 'you're good, but you've a generic face': Rakul
180.article_body: Rakul Preet Singh revealed that before her debut, she went to an audition where a casting director told her, "You're very good but the only problem I feel is, you've a generic face." "I said 'that's what it is, I can't help it'," she added. When asked if she ever questioned herself about that, Rakul said, "No, I questioned them."

181.title: Punjab man returning home with friend killed as fuel tanker crushes him
181.article_body: A 32-year-old man, Sartaj Singh, was crushed under a fuel tanker in Punjab's Kharar on Saturday. The man was returning home with his friend, Anil Kumar, when a Bharat Petroleum tanker hit his bike. Sartaj was crushed under the wheels of the tanker and was rushed to the hospital. He was declared brought dead. Case was registered against tanker driver.

182.title: Ahan and I had to do The Dirty Picture scene for Tadap chemistry read: Tara
182.article_body: Actress Tara Sutaria, who starred in 'Tadap' alongside actor Ahan Shetty, said for the chemistry reading, they had to act and recite 'The Dirty Picture' scene and dialogues. She added, "I was handed a printout of a scene from 'The Dirty Picture'...[Director]...asked me to read through it with Ahan and we casually acted it." "It felt completely right," Tara said.

183.title: Was doing people favours instead of choosing the right scripts: Preeti
183.article_body: Actress Preeti Jhangiani, while talking about her career, said she did people favours instead of choosing the right scripts for her career. "Let's just put it to not having enough experience in choosing right scripts or not having somebody to help me chart out my career plan as I should have. Today I would be a little hard-hearted," she said.

184.title: Special flight carrying 160 Indian students evacuated from Ukraine reaches Delhi
184.article_body: A special flight, carrying 160 Indian evacuees from Ukraine, landed in New Delhi on Monday from Budapest in Hungary. The Air Asia flight evacuated the stranded students and landed at the airport at around 4:00-4:30 am. "After we crossed the Ukraine border, the Indian Embassy provided all the facilities," Gowardhan, a student said.

185.title: 24,302 mangroves to be felled for Virar-Dahanu railway line expansion in Palghar
185.article_body: The Mumbai Railway Vikas Corporation will divert 26.5 hectares of forest land across 11 villages in Palghar to expand the existing railway line between Virar and Dahanu stations. As per official documents, the project will lead to the felling of 25,438 trees, including 24,302 mangroves. Compensatory afforestation has been proposed on 54 hectares of degraded land in three nearby villages.

186.title: Javed Akhtar watched 'The Fame...' asked me 'when is season 2 coming': Madhuri
186.article_body: Madhuri Dixit revealed lyricist Javed Akhtar called her up "out of the blue" and asked about season two of 'The Fame Game'. Madhuri said, "He binged watched it. He said, 'Bhai batao season 2 kab araha hai (Tell me when is season two coming out)'." "He said he loved it and I was so glad," she added.

187.title: 4 including 2 foreign nationals arrested for MDMA sale in Bengaluru
187.article_body: Four people, including two foreign nationals, have been arrested by the police in Bengaluru for the alleged possession and sale of MDMA, the city's DCP (North East Division) Anoop A Shetty said on Sunday. Police also reportedly seized 105 gm of MDMA worth about ₹2.8 lakh from them. The arrests were made after police received a tip-off, according to reports.

188.title: Kevin De Bruyne, Riyad Mahrez score 2 each as Man City beat Man United 4-1
188.article_body: Kevin De Bruyne and Riyad Mahrez both scored twice as Manchester City beat Manchester United 4-1 in the Premier League. With the win, City restored their gap at the top of the standings to six points over Liverpool, who have a game in hand. United, who were playing without Cristiano Ronaldo, are now placed fifth in the points table.

189.title: Top 4 IT firms to hire 1.4 lakh freshers for FY23: Report
189.article_body: Cognizant, HCL Tech, Wipro, and Tech Mahindra will together hire 1,40,000 freshers for the coming year, as per Moneycontrol. To meet this growing demand, NIIT stated that it is training graduates through its new-age online courses by imparting 360⁰ technical competencies and workplace soft skills with an assured placement at ₹10 LPA* upon course completion.

190.title: The film got made but it never came out: Kirti on being offered film at 17
190.article_body: Actress Kirti Kulhari was reportedly offered a film at the age of 17. Reports said that it was a Sushant Misra movie. "The film got made but it never came out. I wanted to give acting a proper try...There was calling from within...I finished my post graduation and asked parents to give me two years to pursue acting," she added.

191.title: Footwear thrown at Fadnavis' car in Pimpri-Chinchwad during visit
191.article_body: Footwear was thrown at the car of former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis in Pimpri-Chinchwad, where he was visiting to inaugurate a developmental work on Sunday. The incident took place as NCP and BJP workers clashed with each other while Fadnavis arrived for the event. A police official said that mild lathi-charge was used to bring the situation under control.

192.title: 986 dark, dimly-lit areas and spots with poor phone network in Delhi: Audit data
192.article_body: There are 986 dark and dimly-lit areas and spots with poor phone network in Delhi, as per an audit conducted by Delhi Police. Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana asked all DCPs about their efforts to improve the situation. Police said network issues often act as a hindrance for users of women's safety mobile app 'Tatpar', when they try to share details.

193.title: Scum shelling our cities will not have a quiet place on Earth except a grave: Zelenskyy
193.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said Russia's audacity is a clear signal for the West that the imposed sanctions aren't enough. He said, "We'll punish everyone who committed atrocities in this war. We'll find every scum who was shelling our cities, our people...who was giving orders. You'll not have a quiet place on this Earth – except for a grave."

194.title: B'luru Police clean sign boards for motorists' visibility, share pics
194.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police on Sunday took to Twitter to share pictures of signal lights, blinkers and sign boards being cleaned in various parts of the city. The sign boards and traffic notification panels were cleaned for them to be visible to motorists in the city. The pictures were shared from Adugodi, KG Halli and Pulakeshi areas.

195.title: Ukraine's Foreign Minister shares pic of 500-kg Russian bomb that failed to explode
195.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has claimed that a 500-kg Russian bomb fell on a residential building in Chernihiv and didn't explode. Sharing a picture of the bomb, he wrote, "Many other did, killing innocent men, women and children. Help us protect our people from Russian barbarians! Help us close the sky. Provide us with combat aircraft. Do something!"

196.title: India's envoy to Palestine Mukul Arya found dead inside embassy
196.article_body: India's envoy to Palestine Mukul Arya was found dead inside the embassy in Ramallah on Sunday. "Deeply shocked to learn about the passing away of India’s Representative at Ramallah, Shri Mukul Arya. He was a bright and talented officer with so much before him," External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar tweeted. The cause of his death is not yet known.

197.title: Voting underway for 54 seats in final phase of UP Assembly elections
197.article_body: Voting for the seventh and final phase of Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections began at 7 am on Monday. Overall 613 candidates across 54 seats in nine districts, including PM Narendra Modi's parliamentary constituency Varanasi, are in fray. "I request all voters to participate in the...last phase of elections with full enthusiasm and create a new voting record," PM Modi tweeted.

198.title: 'Gender Equality Run' organised in Hyderabad, pics surface
198.article_body: Hyderabad Police took to Twitter to share pictures from the 'Gender Equality Run' that was organised at People's Plaza Necklace Road in the city on Sunday. "Pleasant Sunday morning...thousands of Hyderabadis gathered at People's Plaza Necklace Road at 5:30 AM [to] participate in the Gender Equality Run organised by SHE teams...to mark upcoming women's day on March 8th," Police wrote.

199.title: Hyderabad Police urge people to give info on narcotics, share number
199.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Sunday took to Twitter to share a post about drug awareness. "Addiction not only kills the addict but also kills the family!! We urge the citizens to share any type of information of marijuana, ganja & other narcotics through WhatsApp or SMS to 9490617111. Your identity will be kept confidential," police wrote.

200.title: McDonald's sued for $900 million by US startup over false advertising claims
200.article_body: US-based Kytch, which sells devices to fix broken ice cream machines, has sued McDonald's for $900 million alleging false advertising and tortious interference with its business. As per Kytch, McDonald's told its franchisees that the startup's devices violated their machines' warranties and could lead to "serious human injury". Kytch denied both the claims and accused McDonald's of defamation.

201.title: Mumbai man jailed for taking shirt off before policewomen
201.article_body: A 38-year-old Mumbai man was jailed for 10 days for removing his shirt and making an indecent gesture in front of women officers in a fit of anger at a police station. Ganesh Kharwa was convicted along with Babu Kharwa, a man he was publically fighting with in 2016. The other man was also handed a 10-day sentence.

202.title: Woman loses ₹5 lakh in KYC fraud, breaks phone to prevent more loss
202.article_body: A 56-year-old woman from Mumbai's Mira Road lost ₹5 lakh after getting a call from a person claiming to update her KYC. The caller gained remote access of the victim's phone after making her download an application. Being unable to switch off her phone after realising she was being duped, the victim broke it to prevent further loss.

203.title: Poor are BJP's wealth, will give us over 300 seats in UP: Minister
203.article_body: Ahead of the last phase of Uttar Pradesh elections, Union Minister Mahendra Nath Pandey on Sunday said the poor are BJP's "wealth" and will take it beyond the 300-seat mark. "Mulayam Singh Yadav is...saying the BJP has not done anything for the poor. There will be no impact of such statements," Pandey added.

204.title: BJP blames TMC's terror, police harassment for WB civic poll rout
204.article_body: The West Bengal BJP on Saturday alleged "terror" perpetrated by ruling Trinamool Congress (TMC) and harassment of its workers by police are reasons for its poor performance in the civic body polls. The claims were made at an organisational meeting of the party in Kolkata. "The state police was...acting as an extension of the ruling party," a BJP leader said.

205.title: J&K Police bust Jaish-e-Mohammad module in Awantipora, arrest 4
205.article_body: J&K Police on Sunday said the force arrested four terror associates after busting a terror module of banned terrorist organisation Jaish-e-Mohammad in Awantipora. Preliminary investigation revealed they were providing shelter, logistical support, transportation and arms/ammunition to terrorists. The associates were identified as Umar Dar, Soraj Malik, Irshad Ahmad Lone and Afnan Javeed Khan.

206.title: 5 men arrested with 7 stolen bikes in Indore, keys & tools recovered
206.article_body: Five men were arrested by the Crime Branch on Saturday after they stole seven bikes in Madhya Pradesh's Indore. The arrests were made after police received information that some men were seen planning a theft in the Palasia area. The police seized the stolen bikes from their possession and also recovered some keys and other tools.

207.title: Govt official killed, 2 hurt after car hits tree in Maha's Beed
207.article_body: A government official has died and two others have been injured after their car rammed into a tree in Maharashtra's Beed district. Police said the incident happened in Rakshasbhuvan Road in Georai taluka at around 2 am on Sunday. The deceased was identified as Nitin Jadhav, a Mandal officer in Beed, who was returning to district headquarters with other personnel.

208.title: Security forces arrest active LeT terrorist in J&K's Ganderbal
208.article_body: Security forces on Sunday arrested an active terrorist of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) from Jammu and Kashmir's Ganderbal district. Upon seeing an intensive security check, the terrorist tried to escape but was challenged and later caught, the police said. The terrorist has been identified as Mohammad Altaf Wani, a resident of Shopian's Keegam village.

209.title: 1,234 Haryana students evacuated from Ukraine: CM Khattar
209.article_body: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday said around 1,800 students from the state were stuck in Ukraine, of which 1,234 have been evacuated so far. He further said that 80 students are still stuck in Ukraine, while others have reached the country's borders. The CM added that students who have completed their course will be given internship opportunities.

210.title: Tripura to convert jail to library, name it after ex-B'desh PM
210.article_body: The Tripura government is planning to convert the old Central Jail compound into a library named after Bangladesh's father of the nation Sheikh Mujibur Rahman. The former Bangladesh PM had, according to historians, spent a night at the complex during Bangladesh's liberation war before meeting the then Tripura CM. However, no official records of the meeting were kept.

211.title: Citizens stuck in Ukraine as Centre was asleep: Congress leader
211.article_body: Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole on Sunday said that Indian citizens remain stranded in Ukraine "because the Central government was asleep". "PM Narendra Modi is a campaigner. He remained busy in campaigning. The foreign policy of the government has failed," Patole added. Eight flights, five from Hungary and three from Romania, are expected to bring back over 1,500 Indians tomorrow.

212.title: K'taka CM inaugurates regional forensic science lab in Hubballi
212.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday inaugurated a regional forensic science laboratory in Hubballi. He said that DNA, Cyber, Mobile, Documentation and Audio-Video sections have been already opened here but there's a need to establish a Narcotics section. He further said that Hubballi and Ballari FSLs were announced in the previous budget, now they've become a reality within a year.

213.title: He was killed as part of a conspiracy: Cong MP on Anis Khan's death
213.article_body: Congress activists staged a protest in Kolkata on Sunday demanding justice for student activist Anis Khan and Congress MP Adhir Chowdhury said that his death was "part of a conspiracy". "People from the state government and police are involved. We want justice for him," he further said. Two people have been arrested in connection with Khan's murder case so far.

214.title: Ex-NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna, accused of sharing info with 'yogi', arrested by CBI
214.article_body: NSE's former CEO Chitra Ramkrishna, accused of sharing confidential information with a 'Himalayan yogi', has been arrested by the CBI in connection to the NSE co-location case in Delhi. A Delhi court on Saturday rejected Ramkrishna's anticipatory bail application while calling CBI's conduct in the case "lackadaisical". Notably, the CBI has already arrested her former colleague Anand Subramanian.

215.title: BJP’s Priya Chaudhary, Cong's Pawan Sharma join AAP
215.article_body: BJP leader Priya Chaudhary and Congress leader Pawan Sharma joined the Aam Aadmi Party at an event in Delhi on Sunday and were welcomed by AAP leader Durgesh Pathak. While addressing a press conference, Pathak said "many people are joining AAP" after being influenced by CM Arvind Kejriwal, who has presented a "model of work in every area in Delhi".

216.title: Police recover 19 kg 'charas' worth ₹95 lakh from Agra, 3 arrested
216.article_body: Three people were arrested and 18.98 kg 'charas' worth ₹95 lakh was recovered from them in a joint operation by the Special Task Force, Kanpur and Agra Police, officials said on Sunday. The accused smuggled the 'charas' from Nepal and brought it to Agra via Lucknow and Kanpur. They were arrested from Agra's Yamuna Bridge on Saturday, police said.

217.title: Police detain over 4,000 people at anti-war protests in Russia
217.article_body: Russian police detained over 4,300 people on Sunday for nationwide protests against Russian invasion of Ukraine. As per Russia's Interior Ministry, 5,200 people had taken part in the protests out of which around 1,700 were detained in Moscow. "The screws are being fully tightened, essentially we are witnessing military censorship," said Maria Kuznetsova, spokeswoman of protest monitor, OVD-Info.

218.title: Either deport us or grant citizenship: Pakistani women in Kashmir
218.article_body: A Pakistani woman in Kashmir has said that she and other women like her have been lodging regular protests to ask government to either give them citizenship documents or deport them. "The government, by denying us citizenship, is spoiling the future of our children," she added. Another woman said, "For which sin are Pakistani wives being punished by the government?"

219.title: SRK hugs driver & greets airport security with folded hands, video goes viral
219.article_body: A video of actor Shah Rukh Khan hugging his driver goodbye before leaving for Spain at the Mumbai airport has gone viral online. In the same video, Shah Rukh was also seen greeting the CISF personnel at the airport entrance with folded hands, with many fans appreciating the gesture, some called the actor humble for greeting the security staff.

220.title: Pay disparity between successful actor, actress is ridiculous: Shruti
220.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan revealed that she was being paid "peanuts" in the initial stage of her acting career. Shruti said, "The pay parity bothers me now because it's been 12 years and I have proven myself." She added, "In general, if you compare the most successful actress and the most famous successful actor, the pay disparity is ridiculous."

221.title: Ashwin is an all-time great, he keeps getting better: Rohit Sharma
221.article_body: Terming Ravichandran Ashwin an "all-time great" after he overtook Kapil Dev's tally of 434 Test wickets to become India's second-highest Test wicket-taker, captain Rohit Sharma said the off-spinner keeps getting better every time. "He's been playing for so many years and performed for the country," he added. With 436 wickets, Ashwin is currently ninth in highest wicket-takers in Test cricket.

222.title: Be ready to leave on short notice: India to students stuck in Ukraine's Sumy
222.article_body: The Indian embassy in Ukraine on Sunday evening asked students stuck in Ukraine's Sumy to "be ready to leave on short notice" and that confirmed time and date for their evacuation will be issued soon. "Team from Embassy...is stationed in Poltava City to coordinate the safe passage of Indian students stranded in Sumy to western borders via Poltava," it added.

223.title: People sad with work of UP BJP government: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav
223.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on being asked why people are voting for his party in current polls said it's because they're sad with BJP government's work. While talking about the alleged 'shortcomings' of CM Yogi Adityanath's government, he further said public's voice was suppressed. "This government isn't ready to listen to people," he added.

224.title: Not a military operation, it's war: Pope on Russian invasion of Ukraine
224.article_body: Pope Francis said on Sunday that the Russian invasion of Ukraine is a war and not "just a military operation". "In that martyred country (Ukraine), the need for humanitarian assistance is growing by the hour," Pope added, reiterating his appeal for peace and the creation of humanitarian corridors. Russia has termed its actions in Ukraine a “special operation”.

225.title: I implore that common sense prevails: Pope urges for peace amid Russia-Ukraine war
225.article_body: Pope Francis on Sunday urged for peace amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war and said, "I implore that the armed attacks cease and that negotiation - and common sense - prevail." He said, "I make a heartfelt appeal for humanitarian corridors to be genuinely secured," while adding, "I thank all those who are taking in refugees."

226.title: I'm used to doing films that take over 4 yrs to complete: Prabhas
226.article_body: Actor Prabhas has said he is used to doing films which take over four years to complete. He, however, adds, "Doing one film and concentrating on that is always more comfortable than doing multiple projects simultaneously." "I'm...planning a comedy film which is not mounted on a huge scale. I don't always want to do big films," he said.

227.title: Hollywood still struggles with diversity in true sense: Lilly
227.article_body: Indo-Canadian star Lilly Singh has said although Hollywood is taking small steps towards representation, it still "really struggles with diversity in true sense". "There are only a handful of...movies in America that show South Asians on screen," she said. "My agenda is to make sure South Asian people get the credit they deserve," she added.

228.title: Ukraine, Russia display weapons at Saudi defence show amid conflict
228.article_body: Amid the Ukraine-Russian conflict, weapons makers from the two countries displayed their military hardware at the World Defense Show in Saudi Arabia. Ukraine is showcasing Kozark 7 and Kozark 2M tactical armoured vehicles and anti-drone systems at the show. Meanwhile, displays from Russian weapons makers included anti-aircraft weapons and air defence systems.

229.title: We should treat Russia as a terrorist state: Ukraine's envoy to US
229.article_body: In an interview with Fox News, Ukraine's envoy to the US Oksana Markarova on Sunday said, "This is a terrorist state and we should treat Russia as a terrorist state." She called for the US to impose tougher sanctions on Russia and to increase arms supplies to Ukraine. Markarova also accused Russia of committing war crimes by targeting civilians.

230.title: People made to remove black masks, socks, clothing at Pune venue visited by PM
230.article_body: People were made to remove black masks, socks and even black shirts as they entered the MIT College venue in Pune, where PM Narendra Modi inaugurated several developmental projects on Sunday, PTI reported. "There must be some confusion as the instruction was about black flags and black pieces of cloth, not about clothing (itself)," Pune Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta said.

231.title: OTT world has revived me in many ways: Prateik Babbar
231.article_body: Actor Prateik Babbar has said the OTT world has "revived" him in many ways. "It has given me opportunities to showcase my work. My goal has been the same...to be the best at what I do," he said. "There are many dreams to achieve, many checkboxes to tick! I have enjoyed all the work that I have done," he added.

232.title: Allu Arjun celebrates 11th wedding anniversary with Sneha
232.article_body: Actor Allu Arjun wrote a note for his wife Sneha Reddy as the couple celebrated their 11th wedding anniversary on Sunday. "Happy anniversary cutie. 11 years of togetherness," the actor wrote in an online post. Allu Arjun also shared pictures of celebrating the occasion with his wife and two children by cutting a cake.

233.title: Mobile dental van worth ₹34 lakh launched in Himachal Pradesh
233.article_body: A mobile dental van worth ₹34.53 lakh was launched in Himachal Pradesh on the occasion of National Dentist's Day on Sunday. CM Jairam Thakur, who flagged off the van, said it would help in organising dental treatment camps at schools and other far-flung areas where facilities weren't available. The van is equipped with a fully-automatic chair and other accessories.

234.title: It was team and Jadeja's decision, shows how selfless he is: Rohit on declaration
234.article_body: Talking about declaring India's first innings at 574/8 against Sri Lanka in the Mohali Test with Ravindra Jadeja not out on 175, captain Rohit Sharma said, "There was a question whether to declare or not." He added, "Eventually, it was the team's decision and Jadeja's decision to put them in and it shows how selfless he is."

235.title: Delhi man shot 4 times in Ukraine to be brought back on Monday
235.article_body: Delhi resident Harjot Singh, who was shot four times in Ukraine while trying to flee the country, will be brought back home on Monday. Union minister VK Singh took to Twitter to share the news while mentioning that the student had sustained bullet injuries in Kyiv and lost his passport. "I want to start afresh," Singh said after regaining consciousness.

236.title: Jadeja upping his game every time, he's hungry for success: Rohit
236.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma has said Ravindra Jadeja is upping his game every time, adding he's one of the top after the all-rounder helped India win the first Test of the two-match series against Sri Lanka in Mohali. "He's quite hungry for success...to get runs and do well for the team," Rohit added. Jadeja scored 175* and took nine wickets.

237.title: Pune Metro will reduce carbon emissions to larger extent: PM Modi
237.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said that the Pune Metro will "reduce carbon emissions to a larger extent". He added that the service would make transportation easier, make the city pollution-free, and help people to avoid traffic jams and use a better mode to travel. He further explained that this would bring ease of living in the city.

238.title: 4 teenage boys drown in Narmada river in Madhya Pradesh
238.article_body: Four boys aged 18-19 drowned while bathing in the Narmada river on Sunday in Madhya Pradesh's Narmadapuram, an official said. The incident occurred at Herbal Park Ghat when six boys in the 18-19 age group went into deep water while bathing at around 2 pm, the official added. Two boys were rescued, the official further said.

239.title: What a flawless performance: Anushka on India Women beating Pakistan
239.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma took to Instagram Stories and congratulated Team India for securing a 107-run win over Pakistan in the ongoing Women's ODI World Cup. "What a flawless performance by our women in blue on securing their first win at the tournament. Good luck for the next match," Anushka wrote. Team India will play hosts New Zealand on Thursday.

240.title: Some people making unnecessary statements: Ajit Pawar on Maha Guv
240.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar on Sunday took an apparent dig at Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari while speaking at a Pune event attended by PM Narendra Modi. He said, "I want to bring it to...notice of PM...some people holding important positions are making unnecessary statements." Pawar was apparently referring to Koshyari's earlier statement linking Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj to Sant Ramdas.

241.title: Hindu Sena takes out march in Delhi in support of Russia
241.article_body: Some Hindu Sena volunteers took out a march in Delhi's Connaught Place on Sunday and raised slogans in Russia's support. Hindu Sena national president Vishnu Gupta said, "Not getting into the official Indian stand at the United Nations, we personally think that India, rather than abstaining, should have voted in favour of Russia." The march continued for around an hour.

242.title: Ghaziabad woman gives poison to 3-yr-old son & 2 daughters, kills self
242.article_body: A 30-year-old woman killed herself after giving food laced with poison to her three children, including a three-year-old son, in Ghaziabad on Saturday, police said. The boy died on Saturday itself, while his six-year-old and 11-year-old sisters died at hospital on Sunday. Police said the woman was depressed as her husband, who works as a labourer, was suffering from tuberculosis.

243.title: Indian man refuses to return to India without 8 months pregnant Ukrainian wife
243.article_body: Amid the ongoing tensions between Ukraine and Russia, an Indian man has refused to return to India under Operation Ganga as he doesn’t want to leave his pregnant wife who is a Ukrainian citizen. Gagan, who plans to move to Poland from Ukraine, said that his wife is eight months pregnant and they are currently residing at a friend’s place.

244.title: 1 killed, 1 hurt after being run over by tractor in MP's Jabalpur
244.article_body: A person was killed while another was injured after a tractor ran over them in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur on Sunday. The driver of the tractor allegedly had a dispute over a drain construction with his brother who was injured in the incident, police said. It is being investigated whether the incident was an accident or an intentional attack, police added.

245.title: Will aim to boost energy cooperation with Qatar: Italian minister
245.article_body: Italian Foreign Minister Luigi Di Maio on Sunday said Italy and Qatar will aim to strengthen their energy partnership. "Strengthening ties with Qatar and other countries... will make us autonomous from eventual blackmail from Russian gas," added the minister. This comes as Di Maio and a head of an Italian energy group held talks with Qatari officials over the weekend.

246.title: Court summons Rajasthan CM, others in 2020 phone-tapping case
246.article_body: A local Jaipur court has issued notices to Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot, Chief Whip Mahesh Joshi and others in the 2020 phone-tapping case. They have been summoned to appear before the court on March 16. The notices were issued on a revision petition filed by advocate OP Solanki, alleging the acts committed by these persons were cognisable offences.

247.title: Abhishek congratulates India Women after win over Pakistan in WC
247.article_body: Taking to Twitter, actor Abhishek Bachchan congratulated the Indian cricket team after they defeated Pakistan in the Women's ODI World Cup. "Congratulations Team India. Well done. #INDvPAK #BlueTigresses," Abhishek tweeted. India Women opened their World Cup campaign with a 107-run win over Pakistan. India had set the target of 245 runs, in reply, Pakistan were bowled out on 137 runs.

248.title: US Secy of State meets Ukraine's Foreign Minister at Polish border
248.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken met Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba at Poland's border with Ukraine on Saturday. Blinken, who crossed the border into Ukraine, said, "The entire world stands with Ukraine, just as I'm standing here in Ukraine with my friend, my colleague." The two discussed Western efforts to support Ukraine and isolate Russia during the current war.

249.title: ITBP to hold 'Desh Ki Hifazat...' event on 75 yrs of independence
249.article_body: The Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) is going to organise 'Desh Ki Hifazat-Desh Ki Suraksha' programme from March 6 to 13 to celebrate the 75th anniversary of India's independence. Various programmes like honouring martyrs' families and band displays will be organised on the occasion, a press release by the ITBP said. Free medical camps will also be held, it added.

250.title: Chandigarh traffic police rally promotes use of helmets by women
250.article_body: The Chandigarh traffic police's Road Safety Awareness Week 2022 concluded with a two-wheeler rally on Saturday. The initiative was aimed at highlighting the importance of helmets for women. Around 200 women two-wheeler riders took part in the rally and displayed slogans on road safety. Special awareness workshops were organised in various colonies of the city and nearby villages.

251.title: Saudi defence firm plans to produce indigenous drones: State TV
251.article_body: Saudi Arabian Military Industries (SAMI), a state-owned defence firm has planned to produce indigenous drones, reported state TV al-Ekhbariya. "We are working to establish SAMI as the world's largest munitions factory and localising defence industries," said SAMI CEO Walid Abukhaled. As per al-Ekhbariya report, the kingdom plans to divert 50% of its military spending to Saudi companies by 2030.

252.title: Malayalam director Liju Krishna taken into custody over rape allegation
252.article_body: Malayalam director Liju Krishna has been taken into police custody following an allegation of rape by a crew member of his upcoming film 'Padavettu'. The shoot which was underway in Kerala's Kannur has been halted temporarily and further work on the film has been reportedly stopped following the allegation. 'Padavettu' was to be Liju's directorial debut in the film industry.

253.title: 421 of 454 MP citizens stuck in Ukraine have returned: State govt
253.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh government on Sunday said 421 of the total 454 people hailing from the state have returned from war-hit Ukraine so far. "Some natives of the state are in transit while others are in the process of leaving Ukraine," state Home Minister Narottam Mishra said. He said all such natives of state are in touch with the government.

254.title: Working with father Naseeruddin is my dream, ambition: Vivaan
254.article_body: Actor Vivaan Shah has said that working with his father veteran actor Naseeruddin Shah is his dream and his ambition. He further said that his debut film '7 Khoon Maaf' starred the veteran actor but the two didn't share any scenes. "I know how wonderful it is to work with him because I have done that on stage," Vivaan added.

255.title: Well done: Laxman to India on their innings and 222-run 1st Test win vs SL
255.article_body: Praising India after their innings and 222-run win against Sri Lanka in first Test of two-match series, VVS Laxman took to Twitter and wrote, "Well done Team India." His tweet further read, "Virat Kohli's 100th Test...Ravichandran Ashwin getting past the great Kapil [Dev] paaji to become India's second highest test wicket-taker...Ravindra Jadeja [being] spectacular with both bat and ball."

256.title: 'Few men see women's heads as erogenous zones', jokes Twinkle on hijab row
256.article_body: Commenting on the hijab controversy, actress-turned-author Twinkle Khanna joked, "I must admit hearing a few religious leaders talk about how a hijab stops men from being tempted does make one chuckle." She added, "Very few men would consider a woman's head an erogenous zone. Can you imagine date-night conversations that include, 'Wow your head is looking so hot today'?"

257.title: Will accept refugees from Ukraine irrespective of nationality: Germany
257.article_body: Germany will accept refugees fleeing the Russian invasion of Ukraine irrespective of their nationality, German Interior Minister Nancy Faeser was quoted as saying by local media. "We want to save lives. That doesn't depend on [the refugees'] passport(s)," she added. Additionally, refugees from Ukraine will receive immediate protection of up to 3 years in the EU, Faeser had earlier said.

258.title: Russian gymnast wears war symbol 'Z' on podium next to Ukrainian gymnast
258.article_body: Russian gymnast Ivan Kuliak wore Russia's war symbol 'Z' on his chest as he stood on a podium next to his Ukrainian rival Illia Kovtun during an event in Doha, Qatar. While Kuliak won bronze on the parallel bars at the event, Kovtun won the gold medal. The symbol 'Z' has been spotted on Russian combat vehicles following Ukraine's invasion.

259.title: Over 15,920 Indians brought back from Ukraine under Op Ganga: Govt
259.article_body: India has brought back over 15,920 citizens in 76 flights from Ukraine under Operation Ganga, the government said on Sunday. It added that around 2,500 Indians were evacuated in 13 flights landed in the last 24 hours. Seven flights are scheduled from Hungary, Romania and Poland over the next 24 hours.

260.title: Today's India improving, innovating, influencing world: PM in Pune
260.article_body: While speaking at the golden jubilee celebrations of Pune's Symbiosis University, PM Narendra Modi said that today's India is innovating, improving and influencing the world. "From software to health, from artificial intelligence (AI) to electric vehicles, from drones to semiconductors, the government is bringing reforms in every sector to open up new opportunities for our youth," PM Modi added.

261.title: US & Poland in talks to deliver Soviet-era warplanes to Ukraine: Reports
261.article_body: The US along with Poland is considering a deal to send Soviet-era warplanes to Ukraine in order to boost its defense against the Russian invasions, as per reports. Reports suggest that Poland would send Soviet-era aircraft to Ukraine in exchange for F-16 fighter jets. "We’re looking at it very, very actively," said US Secretary of State Antony Blinken.

262.title: Don't think so: Gambhir on Jadeja's 175* being called standout innings
262.article_body: Talking about Ravindra Jadeja's 228-ball 175* against Sri Lanka in first Test, ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir said he didn't think that it was the standout innings of the all-rounder's Test career. "The innings Jadeja played in Australia or...outside India, he'll get more confidence from that. Stats can be very misleading." It's highest Test score for an Indian at number seven.

263.title: Ajay Devgn & I picked up exactly from where we left: Esha Deol
263.article_body: Actress Esha Deol has said she enjoyed reuniting with actor Ajay Devgn in 'Rudra: The Edge Of Darkness' and added, "We picked up exactly from where we left." "We worked together in the past in a few films but...I think both of us have grown as actors," Esha added. The duo shared screen space in films like 'Yuva' and 'Insan'.

264.title: I just thought, 'Oh my God, there it is': Farrell on Robert's Batsuit
264.article_body: Actor Colin Farrell revealed his first reaction after watching Robert Pattinson wearing the Batsuit on the sets of 'The Batman'. "I got out of the car, in full costume, full makeup, ready to shoot...I looked up on the roof...he [Robert] was looking down, the cape was blowing in the wind...I just thought, 'Oh my God, there it is'," Farrell stated.

265.title: US scientists spot potential afterglow from merger of 2 neutron stars
265.article_body: US scientists detected a potential afterglow from a kilonova, which occurs after two neutron stars merge to create a massive explosion. Originally detected by scientists in 2017, the blast formed a jet of high-energy particles which were replaced by X-rays in 2020. Researchers believed heated debris from the merger created a shock generating X-ray emissions, known as kilonova afterglow.

266.title: UN delivers $32 million to Afghanistan as part of humanitarian aid
266.article_body: UN's humanitarian aid worth $32 million reached Kabul, over a month after Afghanistan's central bank, Da Afghanistan Bank (DAB) announced to have received a similar aid package from UN. Appreciating the assistance, DAB also called on the international community to cooperate with Afghanistan for providing necessary banking facilities. Afghanistan plunged into crisis after Taliban assumed control in August last year.

267.title: Hong Kong reports over 31,000 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours
267.article_body: Hong Kong on Sunday reported 31,008 new COVID-19 cases, 153 deaths in last 24 hours. As residents expressed concerns over a mass-testing scheme, Chief Secretary John Lee said detailed instructions of the scheme will be announced soon. He added authorities will ensure steady food supply. Last month, Chief Executive Carrie Lam announced three compulsory testing rounds for all starting mid-March.

268.title: Admit Ukraine-returnees in Indian colleges at govt cost: Digvijaya
268.article_body: Congress MP Digvijaya Singh has urged the Centre to provide admissions to Ukraine-returned students in various private and government medical colleges in India. In a letter to PM Narendra Modi, Singh wrote that the Centre should make special plan to provide admissions "in interest of the country and public". He also demanded that government pay the fees of such students.

269.title: Woman abducted outside college in UP, gangraped by 5 men
269.article_body: A woman was allegedly abducted by five persons outside her college in UP's Muzaffarnagar who took her to Delhi in a car and gangraped her, police said on Sunday. The accused threatened the survivor against informing anyone about the incident and then dropped her off in Meerut, police added. A case has been registered against the accused.

270.title: Won't end campaign till Ukraine stops fighting: Putin as Turkey seeks ceasefire
270.article_body: In a phone call with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, Russian President Vladimir Putin said the military campaign in Ukraine will not end until Kyiv lays down arms and agrees to all Russian demands. He said this after Erdogan appealed for a ceasefire. This came amid the UN's warning of the fastest-growing refugee crisis in Europe since World War 2.

271.title: Drake files restraining order against alleged female stalker
271.article_body: Singer Drake has filed a restraining order against a 29-year-old woman who has allegedly been stalking his California home for a year. He has claimed that she sent him emails last month, one of which stated he should "put a bullet through [his] head now b*tch". Drake also alleged that she earlier filed a $4 billion "frivolous" lawsuit against him.

272.title: Let students returning from Ukraine study in India: Odisha CM
272.article_body: Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik on Sunday wrote to Prime Minister Narendra Modi and urged him to "enable and facilitate continuance of...studies [of students returning from Ukraine] in the medical colleges in India". He said that they must be allowed to continue "from the stage from which their studies in Ukraine have been disrupted on account of the war".

273.title: How does the World Test Championship points table read after India's win?
273.article_body: After defeating Sri Lanka by an innings and 222 runs in the Mohali Test, India have accumulated 65 points on the World Test Championship points table. India are fifth on the table with 54.16% of points won. Sri Lanka are third with 66.66% of points won. Australia are on top of the table with 86.66% of points won.

274.title: I'm not just a pretty face, voice; always want seat at table: Sona
274.article_body: Singer Sona Mohapatra has said that she is not just a pretty face or voice and has always wanted a seat at the table, adding she's never been shy about stating it. She further said late veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar was the only one in her times among men and women who stood up for issues like copyrights and royalties.

275.title: AIMIM leader injured after being attacked with spade in Ahmedabad
275.article_body: AIMIM Gujarat leader Shamshad Pathan was injured after being attacked with a spade by a group of four people in Ahmedabad on Sunday, police said. He was attacked when he intervened in a fight in a market in the city. Pathan was hospitalised and his condition is stable, an official said.

276.title: Andhra Police seize cash, gold worth ₹5 cr from bus passengers
276.article_body: Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool Police on Sunday seized gold biscuits, silver and cash worth ₹5 crore while conducting a routine check at an Andhra-Telangana border check post. Five people travelling in a private bus from Hyderabad to Coimbatore, who were carrying the valuables, were detained after they failed to produce valid documents for transporting them. An investigation is underway.

277.title: 114 Rohingya refugees from Myanmar arrive in Indonesia by boat
277.article_body: As many as 114 Rohingya refugees from Myanmar arrived by boat in Indonesia on Sunday, an NGO group at the scene said. Some of the people in the group needed medical assistance when they arrived in Aceh province, a volunteer for the NGO said. Authorities were unsure for how long the 114 refugees had been at sea, the volunteer added.

278.title: We repeat, close the sky over Ukraine: Zelenskyy as Russian missiles destroy airport
278.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in a video urged Western nations to impose a no-fly zone over Ukraine following an attack by Russian missiles that destroyed Ukraine's Vinnytsia airport. "We repeat every day: Close the sky over Ukraine," said Zelenskyy. He added, "If you don't do that, if you don't give us aircraft, you also want us to be slowly killed."

279.title: Cuban boxer loses 80% vision after pressure cooker explodes
279.article_body: A Cuban boxer has severely burned both his corneas and reportedly lost 80% of his vision after a pressure cooker exploded. As per Guillermo Rigondeaux's manager, the boxer was cooking Cuban black beans when the pressure cooker exploded, splashing boiling water into his eyes and chest. He added that it was unclear as to what caused the cooker to explode.

280.title: Everyone keeps asking me for it: Peyush Bansal as he shares updates on Kamlesh
280.article_body: Lenskart Co-founder Peyush Bansal on Sunday took to Instagram and wrote, "Everyone I meet these days has one question...What is the update on jugaadu Kamlesh from Shark Tank India?" Bansal informed, "We've initiated a process of design and consumer validation of the cart." He added, "Biggest concerns are: Weight of Cart, movement on different uneven terrains and width of cart."

281.title: BJP is winning 80% of UP seats, no room for 'ifs & buts': CM Yogi
281.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Sunday exuded confidence in winning 80% of the state's total Assembly seats in the ongoing elections and added that there was no room for "ifs and buts". "Our party's politics revolves around development. It is the opposition that has no agenda and keeps talking about casteism and communal polarisation," he added.

282.title: 19-year-old who tracked Musk's jet to now track Russian billionaires' yachts
282.article_body: Jack Sweeney, the 19-year-old student who tracks the world's richest person Elon Musk's private jet, has now created a Twitter account to track the yachts of Russian billionaires, including President Vladimir Putin. Sweeney had started tracking the aircraft of some of Russia's richest people at the end of February after they came under sanctions pressure following Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

283.title: You boost your confidence with such performance: Jadeja on his 175*, 9/87
283.article_body: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja, who scored 175* and took 9/87 in his side's win against Sri Lanka in first Test, said, "Obviously as a player you boost your confidence with such a performance." He added, "I haven't done anything differently, just played to my strengths...I give myself time to settle down." India won by an innings and 222 runs.

284.title: BJP to contest 12 seats in Bihar MLC elections: State party chief
284.article_body: Bihar BJP chief Sanjay Jaiswal said on Sunday that the party will contest 12 out of the 24 seats in the upcoming state Legislative Council (MLC) elections. Jaiswal added that BJP has "no issue on any seat with JD(U)". Elections to the MLC seats will be held on April 4 and counting of votes will take place on April 7.

285.title: Divya announces split from Varun Sood, says 'He'll be my best friend'
285.article_body: Bigg Boss OTT winner Divya Agarwal took to Instagram to announce her split from actor Varun Sood on Sunday. "I hereby formally declare that I'm on my own in this life...I really value and love all the happy moments I spent with him. He's a great guy! He will always be my best friend," she captioned her post.

286.title: Ravindra Jadeja's batting has gone one notch higher: Ashwin
286.article_body: Talking about Ravindra Jadeja's unbeaten 175 runs in the first Test against Sri Lanka, Ravichandran Ashwin said Jadeja's batting has gone "one notch higher". "Jadeja has...come a long way in the last four-five years...his position is a little low for the way he is batting at the moment," Ashwin stated. India won the Test by an innings and 222 runs.

287.title: Time to form iron government of BSP in UP: Mayawati
287.article_body: Ahead of voting for the final phase of the UP Assembly polls, Bahujan Samaj Party President Mayawati on Sunday said, "It's necessary to form an 'iron government' of BSP to ensure...welfare and happiness of all." "The neglected people facing poverty and unemployment can work to change their fate and that of the state with...power of their votes," she tweeted.

288.title: Fruit vendor stabs father-son duo over monetary dispute; arrested
288.article_body: A fruit vendor was arrested from Mumbai's Malad for allegedly stabbing a father-son duo over a monetary issue. The accused had taken a consignment of apples worth  ₹35,000 from the victims. Police said the accused attacked the 55-year-old man and his 30-year-old son with a knife and sickle as he was unable to pay the money back despite repeated arguments.

289.title: Moody's cuts Russia's credit rating to 2nd-lowest on its scale
289.article_body: Moody's Investors Service on Sunday cut Russia's credit rating to Ca, the second-lowest rung of its ratings ladder. Moody's said its decision was "driven by severe concerns around Russia's willingness and ability to pay its debt obligations". "At the Ca rating level, the recovery expectations are at 35% to 65% (of face value)," Moody's said.

290.title: Epic Games, Activision Blizzard stop selling their games in Russia
290.article_body: Epic Games and Activision Blizzard have stopped selling their games in Russia after it launched the invasion of Ukraine. 'Fortnite' developer Epic Games said it will not block Russian players from accessing its games. "We are doing everything possible to assist employees, and their families, who are being directly affected by this tragedy," Activision Blizzard's President Daniel Alegre said.

291.title: 1 killed, over 20 injured in grenade attack in Srinagar market
291.article_body: A 70-year-old man was killed and over 20 others, including a policeman, were injured in a grenade attack by terrorists at the busy Amira Kadal market in Srinagar on Sunday. The policeman was discharged from the hospital after treatment. The Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) said the attack was aimed at security forces.

292.title: Didn't expect Test to finish by Day 3: Karunaratna on SL's loss vs India
292.article_body: Sri Lanka Test skipper Dimuth Karunaratna said his side never thought that the first Test against India in Mohali would get over by Day 3 after the visitors' innings and 222-run defeat. "The batters need to put their hands up and bat longer innings," he stated. Batting first, India declared their first innings at 574/8 on Day 2.

293.title: China's Qingdao reports outbreak of Omicron variant among students
293.article_body: China's Qingdao has reported an outbreak of Omicron variant mainly among middle school students in Laixi county, the city's Municipal Health Commission said. In response, authorities will carry out mass testing for COVID-19 on March 7. The city had reported 88 COVID-19 cases on March 5, all of them of the Omicron variant.

294.title: I find it difficult to meditate, I use NSDR to relax: Google CEO Sundar Pichai
294.article_body: Google and Alphabet's CEO Sundar Pichai in an interview with The Wall Street Journal spoke about how he relaxes, and said, "I found these podcasts which are non-sleep deep rest, or NSDRs." He said, "While I find it difficult to meditate, I can go to YouTube, find an NSDR video." He added, "They're available in 10, 20 or 30 minutes."

295.title: Russian banks to switch to China's UnionPay as Visa, Mastercard cut links
295.article_body: Sberbank, Russia's biggest lender, along with Alfa Bank and Tinkoff on Sunday said they would soon start issuing cards using the Chinese UnionPay card operator's system coupled with Russia's Mir network. This comes after Visa and MasterCard suspended their operations in Russia owing to Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Payments company PayPal also suspended its operations in Russia on Saturday.

296.title: Congress, NCP organise protests against PM Modi’s Pune visit
296.article_body: The Congress and the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) staged protests in Pune on Sunday against PM Narendra Modi's visit to inaugurate various development projects. Pune city Congress unit president Ramesh Bagwe said that PM Modi was inaugurating "incomplete projects and cheating the people of Pune." PM Modi on Sunday inaugurated the Pune Metro Rail project.

297.title: CredAvenue becomes India's 11th unicorn of 2022 after $137 mn fundraise
297.article_body: CredAvenue has become a unicorn after it raised $137 million, taking its total valuation to $1.3 billion within 18 months of inception, the company said on Sunday. CredAvenue is India's 11th startup to turn unicorn in 2022 after the likes of Mamaearth and Xpressbees. Founded by Gaurav Kumar, CredAvenue acts as a marketplace to connect enterprises to lenders and investors.

298.title: Will continue mediation efforts on Russia-Ukraine crisis: Israel PM
298.article_body: Israel will continue its efforts to mediate on the Russia-Ukraine crisis even if chances of success seem unlikely, PM Naftali Bennett said on Sunday. PM Bennett's remarks come a day after his meeting on the conflict with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow. Notably, Israel has condemned the ongoing Russian military offensive and also sent humanitarian aid to Ukraine.

299.title: UK study suggests Stonehenge served as a solar calendar once
299.article_body: UK researchers suggested one of Britain's oldest monument, Stonehenge served as a solar calendar once due to its alignment with the sun during winter, summer solstices. One of the researchers, Timothy Darvill said sarsen stones' layout depicted a physical representation of a year consisting of 365.25 days. Darvill added each of the 30 stones represented a day within a month.

300.title: Trainer aircraft Hansa-NG made by NAL B'luru completes sea trials
300.article_body: India's indigenous flying trainer aircraft Hansa New Generation (Hansa-NG), designed and developed by Bengaluru's CSIR-National Aerospace Laboratories (NAL), has successfully completed sea level trials. The aircraft flew to Puducherry and covered a distance of 140 nautical miles on February 19. In a statement, NAL said it was sent back to Bengaluru after all objectives of the trials were met.

301.title: Tripura govt has sent proposal to Centre for ₹100 cr cultural hub: CM
301.article_body: Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb said on Sunday that the state government has forwarded a proposal of ₹100 crore to the Centre for the establishment of a cultural hub in the state. "The proposal includes the campus of Satyajit Ray Film and Television Institute where short-term courses pertaining to film production and other performing arts will be imparted,” he added.

302.title: Ukraine's Vinnytsia airport completely destroyed by Russian missiles, video surfaces
302.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday said that Russian rockets had completely destroyed the civilian airport in Vinnytsia while urging for a no-fly zone over Ukraine. The Parliament of Ukraine also shared a video of thick black smoke emerging from the airport and wrote that the Russian missile strike consisted of eights missiles, resulting in complete damage to the airport.

303.title: Mary Kom to skip world championship and Asian Games for youngsters
303.article_body: Indian boxer MC Mary Kom has decided to skip this year's World Boxing Championship and Asian Games, according to her statement released by the Boxing Federation of India (BFI). The 39-year-old boxer has decided to skip in order to give more opportunities to the youngsters. However, Kom has confirmed that she will be participating in the Commonwealth Games 2022.

304.title: Public Works Department to revamp arterial Delhi roads
304.article_body: Delhi's Public Works Department (PWD) will revamp its arterial roads having 30 metres or more right of way (ROW) following instructions from the city government, officials said on Sunday. These roads include Flag Staff Road, Sachivalaya Road, Velodrome Road, Satyagraha Marg, Club Road and IG Stadium slip road, among several others, the PWD officials said.

305.title: Bengaluru Police return lost phones to people with app's help
305.article_body: Bengaluru City Police have been able to find and return lost phones to several people after receiving complaints on the KSP e-Lost application. DCP West Division, Bengaluru City, Dr Sanjeev Patil, shared the incident on Twitter with a picture of 10 complainants receiving their phones. DGP Karnataka shared the post and asked people to use the app for lost items.

306.title: Chief of the Air Staff inaugurates vintage car display in Delhi
306.article_body: Chief of the Air Staff (CAS) Air Chief Marshal Vivek Ram Chaudhari inaugurated The Statesman's 'Vintage and Classic Car Display', in Delhi on Sunday. "It's our responsibility to preserve India's heritage. With this exhibition, we aim to display the evolution of cars in terms of design, display, engineering," said Madan Mohan, owner of a vintage car.

307.title: I tried to kill myself multiple times: Poonam on ex-husband's abuse
307.article_body: Actress Poonam Pandey has revealed that she tried to kill herself multiple times due to her ex-husband Sam Bombay's abuse. "Those four years of my life, I couldn't sleep, I couldn't eat...He used to beat me like a dog," she said. Poonam further stated that she was locked in a room and couldn't make calls as her phone was broken.

308.title: IUML chief, spiritual leader Panakkad Hyderali Thangal dies at 74
308.article_body: The Indian Union Muslim League President Panakkad Sayed Hyderali Shihab Thangal (74) died at a hospital in Ernakulam, Kerala on Sunday. Thangal, who was a senior member of the Congress-led United Democratic Front (UDF), was also the Vice-President of a Kerala-based Muslim scholars body. He was the senior-most member of the Malappuram-based politically influential Panakkad Thangal family.

309.title: Kashmir journalist arrested within hours after getting bail from court
309.article_body: Hours after Kashmir journalist Fahad Shah was granted bail by a Shopian court, he was arrested again in another case, his lawyer confirmed. The police arrested Shah in connection with an FIR lodged against him in 2020. The editor-in-chief of The Kashmir Walla has been arrested for the third time in a span of one month.

310.title: Helpline revamp cut response time: Mumbai Railways Commissioner
310.article_body: The Government Railway Police's tie-up with a private service provider to revamp the helpline number '1512' has reduced the force's response time, according to Quaiser Khalid, Commissioner of Police, Railways, Mumbai. He said now the caller is connected to the on-duty constable through a conference call within 30 seconds, adding, "help reaches the caller before the train could move ahead".

311.title: China can't rely on world markets for food security, says Prez Xi
311.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping has said that China can't rely on international markets to ensure its food security. China should focus on its domestic food markets, while making sure it has an appropriate level of import capacity, he added. Notably, Xi made the remarks amid a conflict between Russia and Ukraine, two major exporters of wheat.

312.title: Albania to rename street in capital Tirana as 'Free Ukraine'
312.article_body: A street in Albania's capital Tirana will be renamed 'Free Ukraine' to honour Ukraine's resistance against Russia, the Mayor of the city, Erion Veliaj, said on Sunday. "Our generation will be marked by this...Russian aggression, and...heroic resistance of Ukraine should be remembered in our public places," Veliaj added. Notably, the Russian and Ukrainian embassies are located on the street.

313.title: This will be known as Jadeja's Test: Jaffer on India's win vs SL in Mohali
313.article_body: After India's innings and 222-run win against Sri Lanka in first Test in Mohali, ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said this match will be known as "Ravindra Jadeja's Test". All-rounder Jadeja was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for his 175* and 9/87. Notably, he broke Kapil Dev's (163) record to become India's highest run-scorer in a Test innings at number seven.

314.title: Surprised at exclusion of Broad, Anderson for WI-England Tests: Roach
314.article_body: West Indies pacer Kemar Roach admitted that he was surprised by the absence of the fast bowling pair of James Anderson and Stuart Broad from the English squad for the upcoming Test series. The 33-year-old bowler believes that without the two veteran seamers, West Indies has a "slight advantage". The first Test will take place in Antigua from Tuesday.

315.title: Mumbai Police arrests 2 for spreading fake news against Rana Ayyub
315.article_body: Two persons from Uttar Pradesh have been arrested for allegedly spreading fake news against journalist Rana Ayyub. In a tweet, Ayyub said that the men had accused her of being aided by Pakistan and claimed that she had been banned from Saudi Arabia. After the arrests, the journalist thanked the Mumbai Police.

316.title: Thane man cheats COVID patient of ₹59,750 by promising injection; booked
316.article_body: A case has been registered against a man for allegedly cheating a COVID-19 patient's nephew in Thane of ₹59,750 by promising to provide him with an injection to treat the infection in August last year. The accused had posed as the marketing head of a major pharmaceutical company. He failed to deliver the injection and the patient died in September.

317.title: 4 held for illegally procuring, selling noxious tobacco items in Hyd
317.article_body: Four people have been apprehended by police for illegally procuring, transporting and selling noxious tobacco and gutka materials in Hyderabad. The accused were arrested after police laid a trap near MK Pan shop beside Rajadhani Bar based on a tip-off. Police said the accused persons sold the material to known and needy customers, pan shops, kirana shops around the city.

318.title: Russia targeting populated Ukrainian areas, like in Syria in 2016: UK
318.article_body: UK military intelligence on Sunday said Russia has been attacking populated areas in Ukrainian cities of Kharkiv, Chernihiv and Mariupol to break morale of defending forces, similar to what they did in Syria in 2016. However, the military added Russian forces remain unsuccessful in capturing cities including capital Kyiv due to constant resistance from local militia and Ukrainian armed forces.

319.title: Indian cricketers play with daughter of Pak captain after Women's WC match, pics viral
319.article_body: Pictures of Indian cricketers playing with Pakistan captain Bismah Maroof's six-month-old daughter Fatima after their 2022 Women's World Cup match have gone viral. Commenting on the pictures, a fan wrote, "We want this type of bonding between these countries." ICC took to Instagram to share a picture, writing, "Little Fatima's first lesson in spirit of cricket from India and Pakistan."

320.title: Dropping 9 catches in 5 games unheard of: B'desh head coach Domingo
320.article_body: Bangladesh head coach Russell Domingo has said, "Dropping nine catches in five games is unheard of...Whether it is concentration, confidence or dealing with pressure, I am not 100% sure." This comes after Bangladesh's Nasum Ahmed, Mohammad Naim and Afif Hossain dropped the catches of Hazratullah Zazai and Usman Ghani during the second T20I which Afghanistan won by eight wickets.

321.title: Sonowal casts vote in Assam civic polls, says 'public happy with BJP'
321.article_body: Union Minister Sarbananda Sonowal cast his vote in Assam Municipal Corporation polls in Dibrugarh district on Sunday and expressed confidence in BJP's victory. "Public is happy with the development initiatives taken up by the Central [and state government]," the former Assam CM said. Polling for 80 Municipal Boards comprising 977 wards in the state took place today.

322.title: Hyd Police officer calls ambulance for woman with stomach pain
322.article_body: A Hyderabad Police officer helped a woman suffering from stomach pain after finding her on a road in the city. Rachakonda Police said the woman was found by patrol staff Shiva Shankar, who then called ambulance, checked her health condition, arranged food and later shifted her to Aleti Ashramam. A picture shared by the force shows the woman drinking water.

323.title: Virat Kohli does 'Pushpa' move during India-Sri Lanka Test, video goes viral
323.article_body: A video of former Team India captain Virat Kohli doing the 'Pushpa' move on the third day of the first Test against Sri Lanka in Mohali has gone viral on social media. Reacting to Kohli's gesture, a fan commented, "Never ever seen such craze for a movie in India." India won the first Test by an innings and 222 runs.

324.title: Look for a job you'd choose if you had no need for money: Warren Buffett
324.article_body: Warren Buffett, the Chairman of Berkshire Hathaway and the world's sixth-richest man, has advised college students to seek employment in the field and with the kind of people they would choose if they had no need for money. In his recent shareholder letter, he added, "For when they find that sort of job, they will no longer be 'working'."

325.title: Russia reports over 79,000 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours
325.article_body: Russian authorities on Sunday said the country reported 79,863 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours, bringing the total caseload to over 1.6 crore since the pandemic began. As per Russia's Federal Response Centre, 744 new deaths were also recorded taking the total death toll to over 3.5 lakh. Meanwhile, capital Moscow reported 1,901 new cases and 75 deaths.

326.title: Bowled some bad balls vs India, gave away easy runs: Bismah Maroof
326.article_body: Following a 107-run loss against India Women in Women's ODI World Cup, Pakistan Women captain Bismah Maroof said, "We bowled some bad balls...gave away easy runs." She added, "We were sloppy on the field as well." Bismah stated her side needs to focus on the batting. Pakistan were bowled out on 137 runs while chasing the target of 245 runs.

327.title: Keeping my role secret for 3yrs not a joke: Shantanu on 'Gangubai...'
327.article_body: Actor Shantanu Maheshwari, who made his Bollywood debut in Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', said that keeping his role a secret for three years is not a joke. "COVID-19 stalled the release and it became difficult for me to hide it. At one point, I wanted to announce to the world, 'I'm going to be a part of it'," Shantanu added.

328.title: Pune Metro proves development works can be completed on time: PM
328.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said the Pune Metro project is proof that "development works can be completed on time". "Earlier, foundation stones used to be laid for infrastructure projects but no one knew when they would get inaugurated," PM Modi said while inaugurating a 12-kilometre-long stretch of the Pune Metro. He also inaugurated the RK Laxman Art Gallery.

329.title: S Korea to impose sanctions against Belarus over support to Russia
329.article_body: South Korean foreign ministry on Sunday said it will impose export controls against Belarus for "effectively supporting Russian invasion of Ukraine". The ministry did not mention the details of the sanctions but said they will be enforced in a similar manner as they were imposed against Russia last week. Reportedly, the sanctions will come into effect from Monday, March 7.

330.title: Got messages saying 'kill yourself': Bhavana who accused Dileep of sex assault
330.article_body: Malayalam actress Bhavana Menon, who was allegedly kidnapped and sexually assaulted by a group of men including actor Dileep in 2017, opened up about her struggles. Saying that she was 'victim-shamed' after the assault, Menon added, "After I joined Instagram, I received messages like 'why don't you kill yourself'." She had earlier identified herself as the assault victim on Instagram.

331.title: During Project-K shoot, Deepika asked me if I am shy: Prabhas
331.article_body: Prabhas recently shared his experience of meeting Deepika Padukone for the first time. Prabhas said, "We met on the sets of Project-K. Deepika asked me if I am shy. I said, 'Initially I'm.' Only after getting comfortable with people, I start talking to them continuously." "Sometimes, I irritate them cracking jokes as long as they enjoy my company," he added.

332.title: 8 flights expected to bring back over 1,500 Indians tomorrow: Govt
332.article_body: Civil Aviation Ministry on Sunday said eight flights carrying over 1,500 Indians will operate from Ukraine's neighbouring countries on Monday. Five flights are expected to operate from Budapest, two from Suceava and one from Bucharest. "Under 'Operation Ganga' to rescue Indian citizens, 2,135 Indians have been brought back today (Sunday) by 11 special civilian flights," the Ministry said.

333.title: Thousands march in Serbia in pro-Russia rally amid Ukraine invasion
333.article_body: Thousands of people took to the streets in Serbia's Belgrade on Friday to march in pro-Russia rally amid its invasion of Ukraine. People could be seen waving Russian flags and carrying pictures of Russian President Vladimir Putin at gathering. Notably, Russia doesn't recognise former Serbian breakaway province of Kosovo as independent and has backed Serbia on other issues in UN.

334.title: Deepika, Alia are different people; they have different body language: Bhansali
334.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said that actors Deepika Padukone and Alia Bhatt are two different people. "They are different people. They have different approaches, they have different heights....they have different body language," Sanjay said. He added that whatever roles he had chosen for Alia and Deepika were based on "right casting" and not on who could have played it better.

335.title: In pics: Ukraine residents prepare to defend cities after Russian invasion
335.article_body: Ukrainian citizens are taking up arms, making anti-tank obstacles and joining the Ukrainian Territorial Defence Forces to defend their cities amid the Russian invasion. They're preparing Molotov cocktails or petrol bombs by pouring a flammable liquid into a glass bottle, that can be set on fire for defence. They are throwing Molotov cocktails in open spaces for training purposes.

336.title: Operation Ganga proves India's increasing influence in world: PM
336.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said the evacuation of Indian students from Ukraine under Operation Ganga proves the increasing influence of India in the world. "At a time when other countries are finding it difficult to rescue its citizens, we managed to get our people out," PM Modi said. He was speaking at an event in Pune's Symbiosis University.

337.title: Fantastic landmark: Sachin on Ashwin overtaking Kapil Dev's 434 Test wickets
337.article_body: Reacting to India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin overtaking Kapil Dev's record of 434 Test wickets and becoming India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Fantastic landmark." He added, "To go past Kapil paaji is an achievement in itself. The way you were going, it was only a matter of time." The 35-year-old has taken 436 Test wickets so far.

338.title: Astronomers discover first-ever black hole that spins on its side
338.article_body: A team of international astronomers discovered the first-ever black hole that spins on its side. In the star system, MAXI J1820+070, the researchers found the black hole's rotation axis tilted by more than 40 degrees with respect to its orbital axis. "This finding challenges current theoretical models of black hole formation," said study author, Svetlana Berdyugina.

339.title: Mumbai JCP Vishwas Patil's autobiography to be released in English
339.article_body: Mumbai Joint Commissioner of Police, Vishwas Nangre Patil's autobiography 'Mann Mein Hai Vishwas', originally written in Marathi, is now being released in English. The translated book, titled 'Head Held High', will be released on March 28. It has its foreword written by former Mumbai Commissioner, Julio Ribeiro and has been endorsed by actor Amitabh Bachchan and cricketer Sachin Tendulkar.

340.title: 23-yr-old killed after being hit by a speeding truck in Pune
340.article_body: A 23-year-old man, identified as Subhan Jafir Shaikh, was killed after getting hit by a speeding truck near Dharmavat Petrol pump in Pisoli, Pune. The accused was overspeeding and rammed into the deceased's two-wheeler, causing him to fall. The truck then ran over him, which killed him instantly, according to the police. Shaikh was a resident of Uttar Pradesh.

341.title: Best friend Hiddleston 1st to know about Spider-Man cameo: Charlie
341.article_body: Actor Charlie Cox, who made a cameo as lawyer Matt Murdock in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home', has revealed that his best friend Tom Hiddleston was the first person to know about the cameo. Tom portrays Loki in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Charlie further said that Tom advised him to sneak into the back of a theatre after the film's release.

342.title: Rules must be relaxed for students back from Ukraine: Varun Gandhi
342.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi on Sunday said that medical students returning from Ukraine should be integrated into Indian institutions by relaxing rules. "The Ukraine dispute has left thousands of students mentally broken. On one side, there are bitter memories of the battlefield and on the other, their future hangs in the balance," Gandhi further said.

343.title: COVID-19 hit me like a tonne of bricks: Pregnant Harry Potter actress from hospital
343.article_body: English actress Jessie Cave, who is pregnant with her fourth child, was rushed to hospital. In an Instagram post from the hospital, the 34-year-old actress asked, "Anyone else had covid in 3rd trimester & had it hit them like a tonne of bricks for weeks?" Jessie is best known to fans for playing Lavender Brown in the Harry Potter franchise.

344.title: Girls made us mighty proud: Uthappa on India's win vs Pak in Women's WC
344.article_body: CSK batter Robin Uthappa took to Twitter to praise India after their 107-run win against Pakistan at 2022 Women's World Cup in New Zealand. "Girls made us mighty proud. Phenomenal all-round performance to register a thumping win!! What a start to the World Cup campaign!" he wrote. Ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "What a massive win by the girls...congratulations...well done."

345.title: Tribes may have controlled Roman emerald mines by 4th century: Study
345.article_body: A study by international archaeologists said nomadic tribes from Egypt's Eastern Desert, Blemmyes, may have controlled region's emerald mines of Roman Empire between fourth and sixth centuries. During the excavations, team found a set of buildings occupied or even built by Blemmyes surrounding the mines. The researchers also documented two ritual sanctuaries preserved at the main temple of Sikait.

346.title: Over 1.5 mn flee Ukraine, Europe's fastest-growing refugee crisis since WW2: UN
346.article_body: The UN High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) Filippo Grandi on Sunday tweeted that more than 1.5 million people have fled Ukraine for neighbouring countries in 10 days, the fastest-growing refugee crisis in Europe since World War II. The UNHCR had reported that numbers had crossed the million mark on March 2 at midnight. Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24.

347.title: Sweden & Finland to step up security cooperation amid Ukraine crisis
347.article_body: Sweden and Finland will strengthen their security cooperation amid Russia's military offensive against Ukraine, Finnish PM Sanna Marin and her Swedish counterpart Magdalena Andersson said on Saturday. Marin added that discussions on Finland's possible alliance with NATO will take place in parliament. Notably, Sweden and Finland share close military ties, including conducting joint drills.

348.title: Capricorn sister Deepika was stunning in 'Gehraiyaan': Anusha
348.article_body: VJ Anusha Dandekar on Sunday took to Instagram to praise Deepika Padukone-starrer 'Gehraiyaan' writing that she "really, truly loved it". Anusha further wrote in the caption, "Just like I love this beautiful Capricorn sister of mine. Deepika you are stunning inside and out. And the whole cast was amazing!" Deepika's husband Ranveer Singh commented on the post with heart emojis.

349.title: I didn't think it'll get over in 3 days: Rohit on Mohali Test win vs Sri Lanka
