349.article_body: After India defeated Sri Lanka by an innings and 222 runs in the Mohali Test, captain Rohit Sharma said he didn't think the match will get over in three days. He added, "It was a great game of cricket from our perspective. We ticked all the boxes we wanted to...A lot of performances, landmark Test match for Virat Kohli."

350.title: Doesn't it smell of Ukrainian blood?: Ukraine as Shell buys Russian oil
350.article_body: After UK oil giant Shell purchased a cargo of Russian crude oil at a record low discount, Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba asked the company, "Doesn't Russian oil smell (of) Ukrainian blood for you?" Defending the purchase, Shell said it would choose alternatives to Russian oil wherever possible and will commit profits from the limited purchase to a dedicated fund.

351.title: 14 killed in collapse of coal mine shaft in China's Guizhou
351.article_body: Fourteen people were killed after the shaft of a coal mine collapsed in China's Guizhou province, state media reported on Sunday. The announcement was made after a rescue operation for the trapped miners ended and their bodies were recovered. Authorities are probing the cause of the accident that took place on February 25.

352.title: Schedule for Indian Premier League 2022 released
352.article_body: The schedule for Indian Premier League 2022 has been released. Defending champions CSK will face IPL 2021 runners-up KKR in the season opener on March 26 at Wankhede Stadium. The last league stage match will take place on May 22 between SRH and PBKS. GT and LSG will play their first-ever IPL match against each other on March 28.

353.title: Ajith Kumar's 'Valimai' earns ₹200 crore worldwide in 10 days
353.article_body: Ajith Kumar's 'Valimai' has crossed the ₹200 crore mark worldwide within 10 days of its release. According to trade analyst Manobala Vijayabalan, the crime-thriller film has collected ₹202.64 crore so far at the worldwide box office. As per Manobala, this is the fastest ₹200 crore collection for Ajith. 'Valimai' is directed by H Vinoth and produced by Boney Kapoor.

354.title: For my birthday this year, I climbed up to Tirupathi on foot: Janhvi
354.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said for her birthday this year, "I climbed up to Tirupathi on foot with my aunt and a friend. I think we all need the blessings of...Gods at a time when we are just breathing free again after the pandemic," she added. "Also, visiting Tirupathi was something my mother loved doing with my Dad," Janhvi said.

355.title: Can't play cross-batted shots on this pitch: Parthiv on SL batters
355.article_body: Former India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel questioned the shot selection by Sri Lanka batters in the first Test against India. "I had said that using the sweep shot on this pitch would be dangerous...it's very important to use your feet and play with a straight bat," he stated. "You can't play cross-batted shots on this pitch," he added.

356.title: Woman plays 'What a Wonderful World' as people flee amid war in Ukraine
356.article_body: A video of a pianist playing Louis Armstrong's 'What a Wonderful World' outside Lviv railway station in Ukraine, amid the Russian invasion, has gone viral online. In the video, throngs of refugees are seen milling about behind the woman, reportedly in an attempt to flee eastern Ukraine. A Reuters journalist shared the video, calling the music "hauntingly beautiful".

357.title: 'Baby' maker Neeraj, Sudip to make film inspired by cricketer Pravin Tambe's life
357.article_body: Neeraj Pandey and Shital Bhatia, makers of 'A Wednesday' and 'Baby', have launched a sports dedicated content company 'Bootroom Sports' along with Sudip Tewari. Sudip said they're launching their company with a film inspired by the life of cricketer Pravin Tambe. "He made his international debut at 41 in IPL and is the oldest player in IPL history," he added.

358.title: Given decades to industry, my son should get platform at least: Kishori Shahane
358.article_body: Actress Kishori Shahane said her son should at least be given a chance to be in films even if it's on basis of talent. "My son has been doing theatre since he was a kid...We feel Bobby should be recognised...If we have given decades of our lives to the industry, my son should get a platform, at least," she added.

359.title: Police arrest 3 robbers in Ghaziabad, ₹29,000 & 2 pistols recovered
359.article_body: Three people, including a woman, were arrested on Saturday in Ghaziabad for allegedly robbing people after posing as courier delivery persons. The woman used to supply information to her accomplices about soft targets and she had also trained the duo, the police said. The police have recovered ₹29,000 in cash, two country-made pistols and cartridges from their possession.

360.title: We've successfully managed COVID-19 and Ukraine crisis: PM Modi
360.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said India has "successfully managed COVID-19 and now the situation in Ukraine". "Even big countries are facing difficulty in doing so, but it's India's increasing resilience that thousands of students have been evacuated," he said. The Indian Embassy in Hungary on Sunday said India is beginning its last leg of Operation Ganga flights today.

361.title: Media under attack, journalists should rise to protect their rights: Ex-SC judge
361.article_body: Former Supreme Court judge Justice Madan Bhimarao Lokur has said that media is under attack "in many ways" in the country. "Many journalists have been arrested...for doing their work...Journalists need to stand up to protect their constitutional and fundamental rights," he added. "There are also instances of some journalists being politely asked to toe the line," Justice Lokur added.

362.title: 2nd opium poppy plantation busted in a week in Pune Rural, 1 held
362.article_body: The Pune Rural Police raided a second illegal opium poppy plantation in Shirur Taluka on Saturday, days after conducting a similar action at Indapur taluka. Poppy plants bearing 9 kg pods, worth over ₹4.5 lakh, were seized by police. The farmer was arrested and an FIR under sections of the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act was registered against her.

363.title: Internet backbone provider Cogent shuts its services in Russia
363.article_body: US-based Cogent Communications, an internet backbone provider that carries nearly 25% of global web traffic, is shutting off its services in Russia amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict. The company cited "economic sanctions" and "the increasingly uncertain security situation" for its decision. Cogent provides internet access and data transport offered over its fiber optic, IP data-only network.

364.title: Line of respect was crossed by the Brazilian crowd: Alexander Zverev
364.article_body: Alexander Zverev said the "line of respect was crossed" by the Brazilian crowd during the 2022 Davis Cup qualifier. Journalist Jose Morgado stated the crowd had taken the name of Olya Sharypova, Zverev's ex-girlfriend who accused Zverev of domestic abuse and violence. "When it gets towards your family members...this is where I draw the line of respect," Zverev added.

365.title: Many congratulations: Laxman on India defeating Pak in Women's WC
365.article_body: Ex-India cricketer VVS Laxman has congratulated India Women for their 107-run win against Pakistan in their ICC Women's ODI World Cup opener on Sunday. "Many congratulations India Women on a comprehensive win against Pakistan and starting the World Cup on a spectacular note. Well played," he tweeted. India Women will play their next match against New Zealand on March 10.

366.title: Will be special to play at my home ground Dunedin for 1st time: Bates
366.article_body: Ahead of New Zealand Women's match against Bangladesh in the ongoing Women's ODI World Cup, New Zealand batter Suzie Bates said it'll be special to play the match at University Oval in Dunedin. "It's going to be a pretty cool moment to sing the national anthem and be at your home ground, especially for the first time," she added.

367.title: Visa, Mastercard suspend all operations in Russia over invasion of Ukraine
367.article_body: US payments firms Visa and Mastercard have announced that they will suspend all operations in Russia over the invasion of Ukraine. Both the companies said that cards issued abroad will no longer work at Russian ATMs and cards issued by Russian banks will not be supported by their networks. "We don’t take this decision lightly," said Mastercard in its statement.

368.title: Telangana HC slaps ₹10 lakh fine on filmmaker seeking stay on 'Jhund'
368.article_body: The Telangana High Court has imposed a ₹10 lakh fine on filmmaker Nandi Chinni Kumar who had filed a petition seeking stay on the release of Amitabh Bachchan-starrer 'Jhund'. The court directed Kumar to pay the amount to PM COVID-19 Relief Fund within a month. This comes after the court was told that Kumar was paid ₹5 crore by makers.

369.title: Two-time Olympic champion Eliud Kipchoge wins Tokyo Marathon
369.article_body: Kenya's two-time Olympic champion and world record holder Eliud Kipchoge won the Tokyo Marathon on Sunday. The Olympic gold medalist clocked 2:02:40, which was over a minute short of his world record mark, in his first Tokyo Marathon race. "It's great to now have won four out of the six Abbott World Marathon Major races," said the 37-year-old athlete.

370.title: Rupinder, Lakra come out of retirement, named in India A probables
370.article_body: Veteran hockey players Rupinder Pal Singh and Birendra Lakra were among the 33 players selected for India 'A' men's core probables on Saturday. The duo had announced their retirement after the Tokyo Olympics last year but with their inclusion in the India 'A' probables, they have made themselves available for selection in the senior national team as well.

371.title: Was shortlisted & rejected many times, almost gave up acting in 2019: Wamiqa
371.article_body: Actress Wamiqa Gabbi, who was seen in Kabir Khan's '83', said that she was rejected for projects a lot of times. "I...got shortlisted...many times and [was] always rejected," she added. Wamiqa further said she almost gave up acting in 2019. "That was the year...I decided maybe this is not meant for me, maybe I'm not a good actor," said Wamiqa.

372.title: Rachakonda Police arrest burglar, seize valuables worth ₹24 lakh
372.article_body: Rachakonda Police arrested a burglar, who was involved in various theft cases, and seized valuables worth ₹24 lakh from him on Friday. The accused, Shaik Yamin, had reportedly stolen gold and silver ornaments, other items and cash worth ₹1.5 lakh from the victim's house in Gousekonda village earlier this month. Three others involved in the burglary are still absconding.

373.title: I have actually been lazy and not open to work in the last few years: Bipasha
373.article_body: Actress Bipasha Basu said that she has been "lazy and not open to work in last few years". "But the plan is to return to work in 2022 and do something interesting. I hope I can make announcements very soon," she said, adding, "I have started taking up events, otherwise I was  closed down to doing any kind of shooting."

374.title: Won't return from 2021 knee surgery before late summer: Federer
374.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer said his tennis comeback from knee surgery last year will not be until at least the late summer. The 40-year-old added that his rehabilitation was progressing good enough that he was now thinking in terms of playing again. Federer hasn't played a competitive match since losing at 2021 Wimbledon quarter-finals.

375.title: Rachakonda Police bust prostitution ring, arrest 2 offenders
375.article_body: Rachakonda Police have arrested two human trafficking offenders for allegedly running a prostitution ring in Jawaharnagar, the police said in a press release issued on Saturday. Police invoked the PD Act against the offender, identified as Uduthala Laxmi, who was arrested along with an associate following a raid. A female victim was also rescued from premises, police added.

376.title: People think we are standing on streets & selling our bodies: Sushant Divgikr
376.article_body: Trans actor Sushant Divgikr spoke about how they still have to struggle for proper representation in society. Sushant said, "Everybody thinks we are...standing on the streets and selling our bodies or begging." "Growing up we've been bullied, hit [and] touched at places we shouldn't have been. I still get called names, so imagine somebody from a smaller town," Sushant added.

377.title: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya receives Ukraine-return students in Bengaluru
377.article_body: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya received more than 30 Karnataka students who returned from Ukraine at the Bengaluru airport. "Children and their parents have nothing but gratitude for PM Sri Narendra Modi Ji for leading Operation Ganga from the front," said the MP from Bengaluru South Lok Sabha seat. The students returned from Kharkiv in Ukraine.

378.title: Brilliant win: Tendulkar on India's 107-run win vs Pak in 2022 WC
378.article_body: Following India's 107-run win against Pakistan in their first match of 2022 Women's World Cup, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Brilliant win for Team India!" He added, "The partnership between Sneh Rana and Pooja Vastrakar got us back in...game when we were 114/6...best thing the two did was to rotate strike smartly and convert twos into threes...their mindset helped us win."

379.title: He made everything look so simple: Raina on late Aus spinner Warne
379.article_body: Remembering Shane Warne, Suresh Raina said the late Australian spin legend made "everything look so simple", adding his cricketing knowledge was incredible. "I remember watching that Ashes series of 2005-06 in England and remember being in awe of it. It was such a hard-fought series...Warne was at the centre of it," he added. Warne passed away aged 52 on Friday.

380.title: Army holds winter tuition classes for students in J&K villages
380.article_body: The Indian Army organised winter tuition classes in Jammu and Kashmir to nurture young minds. The initiative was started considering the loss of education due to heavy snowfall and sub-zero temperatures in the region. The classes were organised in remote villages of Mandian, Kundian, Naga, etc. "A total of 380 students were part of initiative," said Sabir Khatana, a teacher.

381.title: Out on bail in murder case, man shot dead by nephew in Amritsar
381.article_body: Out on bail in a murder case, a man was shot dead allegedly by his nephew on Saturday at Ghanupur Kale village on the outskirts of Punjab's Amritsar. "The accused, Amandeep Singh, aka Lalla, wanted to take revenge...for his father's murder," the police said. The weapon used in the crime has been recovered by the police.

382.title: Lataji once asked host to introduce me as king of playback: Udit
382.article_body: Singer Udit Narayan has revealed that late veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar at a concert asked the host to introduce him as the king of playback singing. "I can never forget that. I am sure I must have done something good to deserve that," the singer said. Lata Mangeshkar passed away on February 6 at the age of 92.

383.title: India beat SL in 3 days, extend unbeaten run against them at home to 21 Tests
383.article_body: India defeated Sri Lanka by an innings and 222 runs in the first Test in Mohali to take a 1-0 lead in the two-match Test series. India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja scored 175*(228) and took nine wickets in the match. With the win, India have now extended their unbeaten run against Sri Lanka at home to 21 Test matches.

384.title: Rod Marsh was fearless, Shane Warne was a magical bowler: Elton John
384.article_body: Singer Elton John, in an Instagram post, paid tributes to former Australian cricketers Shane Warne and Rod Marsh, who both passed away this week. "A tragic day for Australian cricket. Two legends passing is heartbreaking," he wrote, adding, "I...played cricket with Rod in Perth. A very special and fearless man. Shane was a magical bowler and such huge fun."

385.title: Govt proactively working on enhancing mass transportation: PM Modi
385.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said the government is proactively working on enhancing the means of the mass transport system at a rapid scale as India undergoes rapid urbanisation. "Now, the Metro services have either become operational in more than two dozen cities of the country or they are approaching completions," PM Modi added.

386.title: 23-yr-old man beaten to death over song request to DJ at marriage in UP
386.article_body: A 23-year-old man was beaten to death after dispute over song request made to the DJ at a marriage function in Uttar Pradesh. Reports said one guest asked DJ to play song on repeat. Some guests objected to it and soon two groups got involved in fight. Deceased, who was acting as mediator, was beaten with stick and later died.

387.title: US teacher charged for slapping student, faces up to 2.5yrs in jail
387.article_body: A 61-year-old teacher in US' Indiana has been charged with battery and faces up to 2.5 years in jail after he allegedly slapped a student across the face. The teacher was recently granted immediate retirement following the incident. A video of the incident purportedly shows the accused grabbing the student's backpack, forcing him into a wall and slapping him.

388.title: 2 Dalit children beaten up for touching utensil containing water in MP; 8 booked
388.article_body: A Dalit family was allegedly beaten up by members of the Lodhi community in a village in Madhya Pradesh's Damoh after two children belonging to the family touched a utensil filled with water, police said. Eight people have been booked in this connection. Five of the family members, including the children, sustained injuries and are undergoing treatment at a hospital.

389.title: Pics show PM Narendra Modi buying ticket before his Pune Metro ride
389.article_body: PM Narendra Modi took a ride on the Pune Metro after inaugurating a 12-km stretch of the metro rail project on Sunday. A picture shared by the Prime Minister's Office shows PM Modi buying a ticket at the ticket counter before taking a ride from Garware College to Anand Nagar. PM Modi also interacted with school students on the train.

390.title: Billionaire Thiel's Founders Fund raises $5 billion in 2 new funds
390.article_body: Billionaire Peter Thiel co-founded Founders Fund has raised $5 billion across two new funds, bringing its total assets under management to roughly $11 billion. The venture capital firm's new vehicles include a $1.9 billion early-stage fund and a $3.4 billion growth-stage fund. Founded in 2005, Founders Fund has invested in several major startups including Meta, SpaceX, Airbnb and Palantir.

391.title: Ukrainian soldiers marry each other amid war without parents, friends; pic surfaces
391.article_body: Two soldiers belonging to the National Guard of Ukraine got married in the Rivne region amid the Russia-Ukraine war. The National Guard of Ukraine's Twitter handle shared their picture and tweeted that the couple married "without a white dress, friends, parents, but with a delicate bouquet of the bride". It added, "They swore, hugged, and went on to defend Ukraine!"

392.title: Pic of Pakistani fan's poster on Australia's Labuschagne goes viral
392.article_body: A picture of a Pakistani fan holding a poster on Australia's Marnus Labsuchagne during the first Pakistan-Australia Test in Rawalpindi has gone viral on social media. "Beware of Marnus...He will say 'No Run' all day and end up with a 100," the poster read. Labsuchagne is known for shouting 'No Run' at times while batting.

393.title: Jadeja's old interview goes viral after he scores ton, takes 5-wicket haul in same Test
393.article_body: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's interview from 2018 went viral after he slammed 175*(228) and took a five-wicket haul against Sri Lanka in the first Test in Mohali. In the interview, Jadeja was asked what cricketing record he would like to have at the end of his career. Jadeja had responded, "A hundred and a five wicket-haul in the same match."

394.title: 300-yr-old mummy of a mermaid-like creature to be studied by Japanese scientists
394.article_body: A group of scientists from Japan's Kurashiki University of Science and the Arts will study a nearly 300-year-old mummy that's in the shape of a 'mermaid'. The mysterious 12-inch creature was allegedly caught in the Pacific Ocean between 1736, 1741. Pictures of the creature show it has pointed teeth and its lower half has scales and a tail-like tapered end.

395.title: Plan was to get to 200: Pooja Vastrakar who helped India score 244/7 vs Pak
395.article_body: India Women all-rounder Pooja Vastrakar, who scored 67 off 59 balls in their ICC Women's ODI World Cup match against Pakistan, has said the plan was to get to 200 as she was told the wicket was slow. Vastrakar came in to bat when India were 114/6 and added 122 runs with Sneh Rana to help India post 244/7.

396.title: Illegal open bar operating in Gurugram shut down after raid
396.article_body: An open bar operating illegally in Gurugram was shut down following a joint raid by the CM’s flying squad and the Excise Department, the police said. The cashier of the establishment was arrested during the raid that was conducted on Saturday night, they added. Over 90 people were found drinking liquor and smoking hookah at the bar during the raid.

397.title: GST Council may raise lowest tax slab from 5% to 8%: Reports
397.article_body: The GST Council may, in its next meeting, raise the lowest tax slab from 5% to 8% and prune the GST exemption list to increase revenues, Moneycontrol reported. A state finance ministers' panel will submit its report by March-end to the Council. The panel may also recommend a three-tier GST structure, with rates at 8%, 18% and 28%.

398.title: Pak cricket captain Bismah Maroof arrives for match with baby in arms, pic viral
398.article_body: A picture of Pakistan’s women's cricket team captain Bismah Maroof is being widely shared on social media after she arrived at the stadium in New Zealand holding her six-month-old baby girl. ICC also shared Maroof's picture. India defeated Pakistan in their first match of the 2022 Women's World Cup in New Zealand on Sunday.

399.title: I'm grateful to Musk for supporting Ukraine in words and deeds: Zelenskyy
399.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy took to Twitter to share details of the conversation he had with the world's richest man Elon Musk, and tweeted, "I am grateful to him for supporting Ukraine with words and deeds." He informed that next week, Ukraine will receive another batch of Starlink systems for destroyed cities. "Possible space projects were discussed," Zelenskyy added.

400.title: Centre indifferent to Indians in Ukraine: Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury
400.article_body: Congress' Lok Sabha leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury has criticised the Centre for allegedly displaying "all kinds of apathy and indifference towards Indians" stranded in the war-hit Ukraine. "The (central) government was busy in campaigning for the elections when evacuation [activities] should have been given the top priority," added Chowdhury. He also accused PM Modi of "misleading" Indians.
